author: Ben Danielewicz
comment: By far the best tracking app I've tried.  Great selection of base maps.  Lots of custom features.  (Took a bit of time to figure out my favorite preferences.)   Has everything I need.

author: JvK in the USA
comment: Nice app but needs Google Drive integration and more USA topo maps.  App seems to be geared to Europe mostly.

reply.author: FrogSparks
reply.content: You can select Google Drive as the location MyTrails, as well as open tracks stored in Drive. Available maps are ideed skewed toward Europe, but that's mostly because there are many country-specific maps. If you'd like to suggest US maps, I would gladly include them in the app — and use them the next time I visit.

comment: Super !  Logical/pragmatic-it works!  Clearly developed by a "doer" that knows our outdoor needs.

author: Adam Kautz
comment: Can't get any mail of Jamaica to display.

author: K Trumble
comment: Map of Phoenix is about 25 years old.

reply.author: FrogSparks
reply.content: I don't make the maps, I just make them available within the app… If you find a better map and it's accessible and compatible, I can add it to the app or show you how to do it yourself. If not, then better give Phoenix a two-star review ;-)

author: Jill Goldsmith
comment: I love it

author: David Dinius
comment: This app works quite well. The interface is there and easy to get the hang of. I used this today for a state forest and it contained all the trails (a lot more than I thought it would). My only complaint is that offline mapping is a little weird. Other than that, a very good alternative to Gaia

author: Travis Taylor
comment: One of my favorite apps, easy to use and functions very well.  Downloading for offline use is great. Just needs two additional features for me to give 5 stars. Needs ability to add photos to the track and the ability to export as a kmz file. Then it would be perfect.

reply.author: FrogSparks
reply.content: Photo and kmz are indeed planned, but I have other features and fixes to work on first, so it'll be a while, sorry…

author: Jyah Goodall
comment: I have tried alot of similar apps and this is definately the best android app. Reliable  and easy to use. Easy on the battery and lots of features and functions.

author: Andrey Lappo
comment: Плюсы: лучшая из подобных бесплатных программ на Google Play, можно поставить метку с заданными координатами, но в формате "доли минут" нужно вручную забивать символ градуса, который в стандартной клавиатуре отсутствует. Зато можно ткнуть метку в любое место на карте и исправить ее координаты на нужные. Есть экспорт в SMS, All-In-One Offline Maps, OruxMaps, Google Maps, Yandex Maps. Минусы: ограниченная демоверсия платной "MyTrails Pro License", нет поддержки пользовательских привязанных растровых изображений в форматах OziExplorer, KMZ и Garmin, нет размера сохраненных offline-карт в списке. На Blackview BV8000 Pro (Android 7.0) при наличии разрешения писать на карту памяти, это не делает ("Эта папка не доступна для записи, выберите другое место"). А без кэша на внешней памяти приложение теряет изрядную долю своей привлекательности. Одноместный (прозрачный) виджет не работает - место занимает, но ничего не отображает, вообще.

author: Edvin Kasimati
comment: SuperApp

author: Devtest Devtest
comment: Drawn route has quirks and artefacts. Even if there is road on the map between two points the app often fails to draw it properly. The app is trying to check the license :)  when there is no internet connection. This is supposed to work when hiking in the middle of the mountains, not to complaint about connectivity for checking the license.

reply.author: FrogSparks
reply.content: Unlike Google Maps, MyTrails doesn't know where the road is, it only displays an image of it, because it's optimized for topo maps, which don't have that kind of information (but they're much more detailed for off-road). License checking happens only once every two months.

author: Nick Butler
comment: Great app for real-time online & offline TOPO maps. Will record onto the map where I have been.  Lots of little adjustments can be made in the preferences menu to suit the user.  I often use this app where there is no cell phone coverage to record walking or 4wding tracks.  Can be a bit fiddly to get an offline map downloaded, but you only have to do it once and its sorted. You will want at least 8gb memory card for offline maps (all of New Zealand).

author: Jonathan Collet
comment: Multiple GPS troubleshooting notifications even after killing the application, really annoying.
Can`t really rate yet.  Noticed early that its missing a map segment for Englewood, FL.  The segment shown is the next panel west.  Hope to test it later this month when I have some time.

reply.author: FrogSparks
reply.content: I'm not sure which map you're using, but this is likely a map provider problem, not MyTrails. You can switch to another map…

author: William Neal-Eccles
comment: I have been using this app for 2 weeks (Trial Version). I learned what the app can do and used it recently on a hike in the Adirondack Mountians. It functioned with excellent precision. I'll be going Pro Version. If you hike this is the app for you. Many Thanks to the developers.

author: Cameron Wilson
comment: Great value (pro version), works beautifully. Good selection of maps across the world. Great functionality.

author: Jersey dot com
comment: Very nice and getting better.  Like the maps and import choices.

author: Rozzie Smith
comment: I love it.

Great idea to navigate roadless areas using offline maps. This app fails to deliver, it doesn't download maps of the wanted area and it doesn't hold GPS fix for continuous track log. It needs constant restarts to prove even basic statistics like speed, altitude etc. Other apps run fine on my phone. I would happily give it 5* if it worked.

reply.author: FrogSparks
reply.content:
Regarding tracking: I prefer MyTrails to be a good citizen and avoid draining battery. Here is how you can configure Android so it doesn't prevent the app from doing its job: https://www.frogsparks.com/why-does-my-phone-sometime-stop-recording-the-track/
If you still have issues creating offline maps, see the support community https://goo.gl/dZ6BMC

author: Gina Shelley
comment: Way too complicated. Manual doesn't seem to match ap, so can't figure it out. Walked around Pinnacle Lake to test it, and current position never budged from me cabin location. Didn't seem to work with gps. Managed to put a test waypoint on there, and now all it does is tell me I'm approaching the waypoint over and over. No way to delete test waypoint. Don't see this working for me.

reply.author: FrogSparks
reply.content: Hi Gina, sorry about that, the manual is indeed a bit out of date. The GPS location should be working though. If you're willing to dig deeper, you're welcome to ask questions on https://plus.google.com/communities/106923922438517315752

author: Neil Mullen
comment: Great app.. use it all the time when I'm out hunting.. only reason it's not a 5 star is because I can't find how to delete a recorded track. Also when i went to record a new track i lost my previously marked waypoints and am unable to find them. But it has helped me find my way back out of the Bush on several occasions.  I don't hunt without it. Great app for sure.

author: Nicholas Stacy
comment: Very useful for hiking in areas that have many trails and sparsely marked trails. Thoughtful use of waypoints provides a clear picture of where you have been and where you want to go. This app can greatly reduce the chances of getting lost. The information it gives is also fun to use. I really do like this app.

author: Augusto Lopes
comment: Great app. Except for the compass that isn't working properly. It shows east instead of west and vice versa. (Google maps works just fine, though.) Nevertheless, I've been able to use it for orientation combining with a manual compass. Very useful to follow gpx tracks and record your own.

author: jesse Glenn Shaw
comment: I used my trails a long time ago the updating has made it easier for me to use. I'm trying to find the beta version I'll keep looking. I go off road a lot and hike in out of the way places!

author: Blake Ro
comment: App is great. Used it for some military exercises, and to map out the out skirts of forest fires. Will track where you go, and give you statistics along the route. Only thing is, some of the maps just stay as a checkerboard, not actually loading the map. Even happened recently to a favorite map of mine, USGS 7.5 Topomaps.  Other than the userface taking getting used to, and the long load times, pretty good map

author: myg profile
comment: Examined about 15-20 different outdoor apps personal choice is MyTrails. What i found: 1. It is very fast, with no lags during the on/offline maps movement, loading. 2. Full of light, rich maps. (It works offline for sure!) 3. It is accurate.  4. Has light, nice interface. Easy to manage trough the menus even for novices. 5. Does not use lot of storage. 6. Smallest RAM/processor usage than any other, best battery saver outdoor app. 7. The only with auto pause - waypoint mark on no movement detection. 8. Smallest storage for downloaded maps. (A not so big whole mountain took under 3MB with clear visible waypaths)  9. Attention! It works with G Services disabled! 10. It does not make one internet dependent. 9. Im sure have missed more good things, but summary: it’s some between AK-47 and Ornella Muti in ’77. Cons: Would be nice to make photos on waypoints. Future: Keep it simple. The conclusion after simultaneous comparison between BackCountryNavigator, OSMand, GPSEssentials, Polaris, AllTrails and many others. (I remember the names because some of them were real pain in the ass for novice like me.) Some were  slow, some hard to manage, variegated, complicated, net greedy).

author: Robin Horan
comment: So far have been very impressed with this, especially since it uses the UK Ordnance Survey maps. It is very complicated to use but worth the effort to get it working - I didn't read the manual (tried!) but managed to get it to work by fiddling around with the settings. Downloading the area before a walk means being able to trace the route on the go. Would be difficult, as well as expensive, to get a signal on Dartmoor so this is the perfect fix. The OS maps are brill and for around £5 for one year, very cheap.
Best offline map app around. Buy the pro version, it's worth it. If you are an Adventurer you will never get lost, or have to get any other maps.

Went hiking in Austria for a week and offline maps with this app worked great for me. It helped a lot. I do miss planning functionality. Not sure if heights are always accurately given, but that might be a GPS things. All in all it did what I expected. I had a great hiking experience without worries about where I was and where to arrive.

author: Jackson brown
comment: On my android it works better than back country navigator pro.  DEFINITELY more stable and less choppy. Very well done, although not as eady to use as BCN pro.

author: Norman Johnsen
comment: Great app for navigation purposes. I upload a gpx route into Dropbox and load it via the app. I am using open data UK maps and while not as detailed as Ordnance Survey I can still follow the gpx route with no problems. Have never recorded a route with this app so cannot comment on this.
GREAT app! And it was among the few that ran on my old phone. BTW, Google's questions after the rating are completely irrelevant.

author: Bart Conings
comment: So far I have tested out this app, on a 2 day hike where I made a couple waypoints and it seems to do what I suppose to do all good and well, I will keep using it for now and keep my review up to date over time, keep up your good work! +1

author: Rui S
comment: I have this program installed for years on my samsung S3, and it worked quite well. It's fast, responsive, and have many features. However I switch recently to a new phone,, a Samsung A5, and the track I made has a lot of noise (ramdom points) when I walk inside cities, and narrow streets. I know GPS reception is not good in these places, but this app accepts all data que GPS sensor delivers. It seem to have no filter. In this situation (poor GPS) sometimes i "walk" up to a mile away in distance and return back to the same place in a couple of seconds, and this app accept this data as valid points. As a result the tracks inside cities  is a collection of rubish. I realize now that my old S3 should had a very good GPS sensor. I thought this would be a problem of my new phone GPS , but then I realize that other Apps don't suffer from this problem. The program has an option to ignor data from the GPS that make no sense, but this potion don't change anything. I have to find another app...

author: Denise Goodwin
comment: I like the app.  It is easy to use.  However, it doesn't allow you attach photos to your waypoints.

reply.author: FrogSparks
reply.content: Calibrating the altimeter has to be done whenever you move by over 20km or after a few hours. Barometric pressure changes with the weather. Attaching images to waypoints is indeed not yet possible.

author: Kerry Cox
comment: I use this app for Adventure/Dual Sport motorcycling, many times off highway with no cellular data connection. I can download an area where I'm going to be riding and it is great to have the map on my phone without spending several hundred dollars for a GPS.

author: Ryan Hoare
comment: Usefully good as on could expect for the price. Haven't had any crazy issues or failure so far.

author: Aaron Nelson
comment: I've tried quite a few hiking apps and this is by far my favorite! It's easy to use, has awesome maps with excellent detail and has a lot of neat utilities. I love that I can use it in areas where there is little to no cell reception.

author: John Smith
comment: I've used this app for a few years and have had no problems whatsoever. The support is second to none and the selection of maps superb.
